verbose_text: SDN1 techniques allowed the host to conduct an unbiased, random DNA repair, while SDN2 and SDN3 techniques provided repair templates, which prescribed the exact sequence, with which the cut was to be filled : an allele-conversion (in the case of SDN2), or targeted integration of a sequence of interest (in the case of SDN3).
evidence: SDN1 techniques allowed the host to conduct an unbiased, random DNA repair
